00065 
00066 static DECLARE_RWSEM(ioctl_list_sem);
00067 static LIST_HEAD(ioctl_list);
00068 
00069 int libcfs_register_ioctl(struct libcfs_ioctl_handler *hand)
00070 {
00071         int rc = 0;
00072 
00073         down_write(&ioctl_list_sem);
00074         if (!list_empty(&hand->item))
00075                 rc = -EBUSY;
00076         else
00077                 list_add_tail(&hand->item, &ioctl_list);
00078         up_write(&ioctl_list_sem);
00079 
00080         return rc;
00081 }
00082 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_register_ioctl);
00083 
00084 int libcfs_deregister_ioctl(struct libcfs_ioctl_handler *hand)
00085 {
00086         int rc = 0;
00087 
00088         down_write(&ioctl_list_sem);
00089         if (list_empty(&hand->item))
00090                 rc = -ENOENT;
00091         else
00092                 list_del_init(&hand->item);
00093         up_write(&ioctl_list_sem);
00094 
00095         return rc;
00096 }
00097 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_deregister_ioctl);
00098 
00099 int libcfs_ioctl(unsigned long cmd, void __user *uparam)
00100 {
00101         struct libcfs_ioctl_data *data = NULL;
00102         struct libcfs_ioctl_hdr  *hdr;
00103         int                       err;
00104         ENTRY;
00105 
00106         /* 'cmd' and permissions get checked in our arch-specific caller */
00107         err = libcfs_ioctl_getdata(&hdr, uparam);
00108         if (err != 0) {
00109                 CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_ERROR,
00110                              "libcfs ioctl: data header error %d\n", err);
00111                 RETURN(err);
00112         }
00113 
00114         if (hdr->ioc_version == LIBCFS_IOCTL_VERSION) {
00115                 /* The libcfs_ioctl_data_adjust() function performs adjustment
00116                  * operations on the libcfs_ioctl_data structure to make
00117                  * it usable by the code.  This doesn't need to be called
00118                  * for new data structures added. */
00119                 data = container_of(hdr, struct libcfs_ioctl_data, ioc_hdr);
00120                 err = libcfs_ioctl_data_adjust(data);
00121                 if (err != 0)
00122                         GOTO(out, err);
00123         }
00124 
00125         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "libcfs ioctl cmd %lu\n", cmd);
00126         switch (cmd) {
00127         case IOC_LIBCFS_CLEAR_DEBUG:
00128                 libcfs_debug_clear_buffer();
00129                 break;
00130         case IOC_LIBCFS_MARK_DEBUG:
00131                 if (data == NULL ||
00132                     data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL ||
00133                     data->ioc_inlbuf1[data->ioc_inllen1 - 1] != '\0')
00134                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00135 
00136                 libcfs_debug_mark_buffer(data->ioc_inlbuf1);
00137                 break;
00138 
00139         default: {
00140                 struct libcfs_ioctl_handler *hand;
00141 
00142                 err = -EINVAL;
00143                 down_read(&ioctl_list_sem);
00144                 list_for_each_entry(hand, &ioctl_list, item) {
00145                         err = hand->handle_ioctl(cmd, hdr);
00146                         if (err == -EINVAL)
00147                                 continue;
00148 
00149                         if (err == 0) {
00150                                 if (copy_to_user(uparam, hdr, hdr->ioc_len))
00151                                         err = -EFAULT;
00152                         }
00153                         break;
00154                 }
00155                 up_read(&ioctl_list_sem);
00156                 break; }
00157         }
00158 out:
00159         LIBCFS_FREE(hdr, hdr->ioc_len);
00160         RETURN(err);
00161 }
00162 
00163 int
00164 lprocfs_call_handler(void *data, int write, loff_t *ppos,
00165                      void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp,
00166                      int (*handler)(void *data, int write, loff_t pos,
00167                                     void __user *buffer, int len))
00168 {
00169         int rc = handler(data, write, *ppos, buffer, *lenp);
00170 
00171         if (rc < 0)
00172                 return rc;
00173 
00174         if (write) {
00175                 *ppos += *lenp;
00176         } else {
00177                 *lenp = rc;
00178                 *ppos += rc;
00179         }
00180         return 0;
00181 }
00182 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_call_handler);
00183 
00184 static int __proc_dobitmasks(void *data, int write,
00185                              loff_t pos, void __user *buffer, int nob)
00186 {
00187         const int     tmpstrlen = 512;
00188         char         *tmpstr;
00189         int           rc;
00190         unsigned int *mask = data;
00191         int           is_subsys = (mask == &libcfs_subsystem_debug) ? 1 : 0;
00192         int           is_printk = (mask == &libcfs_printk) ? 1 : 0;
00193 
00194         rc = cfs_trace_allocate_string_buffer(&tmpstr, tmpstrlen);
00195         if (rc < 0)
00196                 return rc;
00197 
00198         if (!write) {
00199                 libcfs_debug_mask2str(tmpstr, tmpstrlen, *mask, is_subsys);
00200                 rc = strlen(tmpstr);
00201 
00202                 if (pos >= rc) {
00203                         rc = 0;
00204                 } else {
00205                         rc = cfs_trace_copyout_string(buffer, nob,
00206                                                       tmpstr + pos, "\n");
00207                 }
00208         } else {
00209                 rc = cfs_trace_copyin_string(tmpstr, tmpstrlen, buffer, nob);
00210                 if (rc < 0) {
00211                         kfree(tmpstr);
00212                         return rc;
00213                 }
00214 
00215                 rc = libcfs_debug_str2mask(mask, tmpstr, is_subsys);
00216                 /* Always print LBUG/LASSERT to console, so keep this mask */
00217                 if (is_printk)
00218                         *mask |= D_EMERG;
00219         }
00220 
00221         kfree(tmpstr);
00222         return rc;
00223 }
00224 
00225 static int
00226 proc_dobitmasks(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
00227                 void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00228 {
00229         return lprocfs_call_handler(table->data, write, ppos, buffer, lenp,
00230                                     __proc_dobitmasks);
00231 }

00233 static int min_watchdog_ratelimit;              /* disable ratelimiting */
00234 static int max_watchdog_ratelimit = (24*60*60); /* limit to once per day */

00236 static int __proc_dump_kernel(void *data, int write,
00237                               loff_t pos, void __user *buffer, int nob)
00238 {
00239         if (!write)
00240                 return 0;
00241 
00242         return cfs_trace_dump_debug_buffer_usrstr(buffer, nob);
00243 }

00246 proc_dump_kernel(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00247                  size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)

00253 static int __proc_daemon_file(void *data, int write,
00254                               loff_t pos, void __user *buffer, int nob)
00255 {
00256         if (!write) {
00257                 int len = strlen(cfs_tracefile);
00258 
00259                 if (pos >= len)
00260                         return 0;
00261 
00262                 return cfs_trace_copyout_string(buffer, nob,
00263                                                 cfs_tracefile + pos, "\n");
00264         }
00265 
00266         return cfs_trace_daemon_command_usrstr(buffer, nob);
00267 }
00268 
00269 static int
00270 proc_daemon_file(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00271                  size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00272 {
00273         return lprocfs_call_handler(table->data, write, ppos, buffer, lenp,
00274                                     __proc_daemon_file);
00275 }

00277 static int __proc_debug_mb(void *data, int write,
00278                            loff_t pos, void __user *buffer, int nob)
00279 {
00280         if (!write) {
00281                 char tmpstr[32];
00282                 int  len = snprintf(tmpstr, sizeof(tmpstr), "%d",
00283                                     cfs_trace_get_debug_mb());
00284 
00285                 if (pos >= len)
00286                         return 0;
00287 
00288                 return cfs_trace_copyout_string(buffer, nob, tmpstr + pos,
00289                                                 "\n");
00290         }
00291 
00292         return cfs_trace_set_debug_mb_usrstr(buffer, nob);
00293 }
00294

00297               size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00298 {
00299         return lprocfs_call_handler(table->data, write, ppos, buffer, lenp,
00300                                     __proc_debug_mb);
00301 }
00302 
00303 static int
00304 proc_console_max_delay_cs(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
00305                           void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00306 {
00307         int rc, max_delay_cs;
00308         struct ctl_table dummy = *table;
00309         cfs_duration_t d;
00310 
00311         dummy.data = &max_delay_cs;
00312         dummy.proc_handler = &proc_dointvec;
00313 
00314         if (!write) { /* read */
00315                 max_delay_cs = cfs_duration_sec(libcfs_console_max_delay * 100);
00316                 rc = proc_dointvec(&dummy, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00317                 return rc;
00318         }
00319 
00320         /* write */
00321         max_delay_cs = 0;
00322         rc = proc_dointvec(&dummy, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00323         if (rc < 0)
00324                 return rc;
00325         if (max_delay_cs <= 0)
00326                 return -EINVAL;
00327 
00328         d = cfs_time_seconds(max_delay_cs) / 100;
00329         if (d == 0 || d < libcfs_console_min_delay)
00330                 return -EINVAL;
00331         libcfs_console_max_delay = d;
00332 
00333         return rc;
00334 }
00335 
00336 static int
00337 proc_console_min_delay_cs(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
00338                           void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00339 {
00340         int rc, min_delay_cs;
00341         struct ctl_table dummy = *table;
00342         cfs_duration_t d;
00343 
00344         dummy.data = &min_delay_cs;
00345         dummy.proc_handler = &proc_dointvec;
00346 
00347         if (!write) { /* read */
00348                 min_delay_cs = cfs_duration_sec(libcfs_console_min_delay * 100);
00349                 rc = proc_dointvec(&dummy, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00350                 return rc;
00351         }
00352 
00353         /* write */
00354         min_delay_cs = 0;
00355         rc = proc_dointvec(&dummy, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00356         if (rc < 0)
00357                 return rc;
00358         if (min_delay_cs <= 0)
00359                 return -EINVAL;
00360 
00361         d = cfs_time_seconds(min_delay_cs) / 100;
00362         if (d == 0 || d > libcfs_console_max_delay)
00363                 return -EINVAL;
00364         libcfs_console_min_delay = d;
00365 
00366         return rc;
00367 }
00368 
00369 static int
00370 proc_console_backoff(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00371                      size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00372 {
00373         int rc, backoff;
00374         struct ctl_table dummy = *table;
00375 
00376         dummy.data = &backoff;
00377         dummy.proc_handler = &proc_dointvec;
00378 
00379         if (!write) { /* read */
00380                 backoff = libcfs_console_backoff;
00381                 rc = proc_dointvec(&dummy, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00382                 return rc;
00383         }
00384 
00385         /* write */
00386         backoff = 0;
00387         rc = proc_dointvec(&dummy, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00388         if (rc < 0)
00389                 return rc;
00390 
00391         if (backoff <= 0)
00392                 return -EINVAL;
00393 
00394         libcfs_console_backoff = backoff;
00395 
00396         return rc;
00397 }
00398 
00399 static int
00400 libcfs_force_lbug(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00401                   size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00402 {
00403         if (write)
00404                 LBUG();
00405         return 0;
00406 }
00407 
00408 static int
00409 proc_fail_loc(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00410               size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00411 {
00412         int rc;
00413         long old_fail_loc = cfs_fail_loc;
00414 
00415         rc = proc_doulongvec_minmax(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00416         if (old_fail_loc != cfs_fail_loc)
00417                 wake_up(&cfs_race_waitq);
00418         return rc;
00419 }
00420 
00421 static int __proc_cpt_table(void *data, int write,
00422                             loff_t pos, void __user *buffer, int nob)
00423 {
00424         char *buf = NULL;
00425         int   len = 4096;
00426         int   rc  = 0;
00427 
00428         if (write)
00429                 return -EPERM;
00430 
00431         LASSERT(cfs_cpt_table != NULL);
00432 
00433         while (1) {
00434                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(buf, len);
00435                 if (buf == NULL)
00436                         return -ENOMEM;
00437 
00438                 rc = cfs_cpt_table_print(cfs_cpt_table, buf, len);
00439                 if (rc >= 0)
00440                         break;
00441 
00442                 if (rc == -EFBIG) {
00443                         LIBCFS_FREE(buf, len);
00444                         len <<= 1;
00445                         continue;
00446                 }
00447                 goto out;
00448         }
00449 
00450         if (pos >= rc) {
00451                 rc = 0;
00452                 goto out;
00453         }
00454 
00455         rc = cfs_trace_copyout_string(buffer, nob, buf + pos, NULL);
00456 out:
00457         if (buf != NULL)
00458                 LIBCFS_FREE(buf, len);
00459         return rc;
00460 }
00461 
00462 static int
00463 proc_cpt_table(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00464                size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00465 {
00466         return lprocfs_call_handler(table->data, write, ppos, buffer, lenp,
00467                                     __proc_cpt_table);
00468 }

00662 
00663 static int insert_proc(void)
00664 {
00665 #ifdef CONFIG_SYSCTL
00666         if (lnet_table_header == NULL)
00667                 lnet_table_header = register_sysctl_table(top_table);
00668 #endif
00669         return 0;
00670 }
00671 
00672 static void remove_proc(void)
00673 {
00674 #ifdef CONFIG_SYSCTL
00675         if (lnet_table_header != NULL)
00676                 unregister_sysctl_table(lnet_table_header);
00677 
00678         lnet_table_header = NULL;
00679 #endif
00680 }
00681 
00682 static int __init libcfs_init(void)
00683 {
00684         int rc;
00685 
00686         rc = libcfs_debug_init(5 * 1024 * 1024);
00687         if (rc < 0) {
00688                 printk(KERN_ERR "LustreError: libcfs_debug_init: %d\n", rc);
00689                 return (rc);
00690         }
00691 
00692         rc = cfs_cpu_init();
00693         if (rc != 0)
00694                 goto cleanup_debug;
00695 
00696         rc = misc_register(&libcfs_dev);
00697         if (rc) {
00698                 CERROR("misc_register: error %d\n", rc);
00699                 goto cleanup_cpu;
00700         }
00701 
00702         rc = cfs_wi_startup();
00703         if (rc) {
00704                 CERROR("initialize workitem: error %d\n", rc);
00705                 goto cleanup_deregister;
00706         }
00707 
00708         /* max to 4 threads, should be enough for rehash */
00709         rc = min(cfs_cpt_weight(cfs_cpt_table, CFS_CPT_ANY), 4);
00710         rc = cfs_wi_sched_create("cfs_rh", cfs_cpt_table, CFS_CPT_ANY,
00711                                  rc, &cfs_sched_rehash);
00712         if (rc != 0) {
00713                 CERROR("Startup workitem scheduler: error: %d\n", rc);
00714                 goto cleanup_deregister;
00715         }
00716 
00717         rc = cfs_crypto_register();
00718         if (rc) {
00719                 CERROR("cfs_crypto_regster: error %d\n", rc);
00720                 goto cleanup_wi;
00721         }
00722 
00723 
00724         rc = insert_proc();
00725         if (rc) {
00726                 CERROR("insert_proc: error %d\n", rc);
00727                 goto cleanup_crypto;
00728         }
00729 
00730         CDEBUG (D_OTHER, "portals setup OK\n");
00731         return 0;
00732 cleanup_crypto:
00733         cfs_crypto_unregister();
00734 cleanup_wi:
00735         cfs_wi_shutdown();
00736 cleanup_deregister:
00737         misc_deregister(&libcfs_dev);
00738 cleanup_cpu:
00739         cfs_cpu_fini();
00740 cleanup_debug:
00741         libcfs_debug_cleanup();
00742         return rc;
00743 }
00744 
00745 static void __exit libcfs_exit(void)
00746 {
00747         int rc;
00748 
00749         remove_proc();
00750 
00751         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "before Portals cleanup: kmem %d\n",
00752                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
00753 
00754         if (cfs_sched_rehash != NULL) {
00755                 cfs_wi_sched_destroy(cfs_sched_rehash);
00756                 cfs_sched_rehash = NULL;
00757         }
00758 
00759         cfs_crypto_unregister();
00760         cfs_wi_shutdown();
00761 
00762         misc_deregister(&libcfs_dev);
00763 
00764         cfs_cpu_fini();
00765 
00766         if (atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory) != 0)
00767                 CERROR("Portals memory leaked: %d bytes\n",
00768                        atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
00769 
00770         rc = libcfs_debug_cleanup();
00771         if (rc)
00772                 printk(KERN_ERR "LustreError: libcfs_debug_cleanup: %d\n",
00773                        rc);
00774 }
00775 
00776 MODULE_AUTHOR("OpenSFS, Inc. <http://www.lustre.org/>");
00777 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre helper library");
00778 MODULE_VERSION(LIBCFS_VERSION);
00779 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
00780 
00781 module_init(libcfs_init);
00782 module_exit(libcfs_exit);
